alert.note: Alert for Boone; Lincoln; Logan; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 6:46PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kanawha, southwestern Putnam, Lincoln, northwestern Logan and northern Boone Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 645 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Spurlockville, or 12 miles west of Madison, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Madison, Hamlin, South Charleston, Chapmanville, Spurlockville, Alum Creek, Julian, Gill, Tornado, Harts, West Hamlin, Danville, Mitchell Heights, Seth, Turtle Creek, Ashford, Palermo, Alkol and Mud. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 30 and 77. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
